content: ---POWERING BOOT DRIVE---
---CHECKING DRIVE INTEGRITY---
---DRIVE SUCCESSFULLY VERIFIED---
---BOOT PROCESSING---
---BOOT SEQUENCE FAILURE---
---PARTS RETURNED NULL---
ANLR1437_long_term_memory_module
TAISHI943211_optical_sensor_module
VERITECH88_high_capacity_battery_module
---REBOOTING IN SAFE MODE---
---BOOT SEQUENCE SUCCESSFUL---
There must be something here...
Something something something always looking for something.
Today it's bottles tomorrow it'll be something else, and whatever it is it'll be stupidly hard to find.
Because nothings ever easy...
Wait...
What are you I wonder?
It looks kinda like an AI cartridge back home... but like crappier.
---MOVEMENT DETECTED---
---CALIBRATING GYRO---
Huh heavier than it looks.

content.option: Did you just pick me up?

content: Ahh!
---IMPACT LOAD SUSTAINED 1.4G---
What the what!? It's alive!
Holy crap holy crap hoooly crap!
I can't believe it! An actual live AI cartridge right here.
I've never seen one like this before though.
You must be an old model. Like really old.
Were you sitting here this whole time? How long have you been active?
So if you got turned on a few minutes ago. Where did you come from?
Do you remember anything before just now?
Hello? You there?

content.option: I don't remember a single thing...

content: Whoa...
An AI. In an ancient looking cartridge I've never seen before.
That has just turned on but has no memories whatsoever...
This must be a weird surreal dream. I'm just talking to myself with extra steps.
Maybe I am losing my mind...

content.option: When I woke up it said there were modules missing.
It said they were returning null.

content: What kind of parts?
Oh you can't see me! That must be what this socket is for... or was for.
It looks like it was ripped out. Not cleanly either.
That's not a small part. If the cartridge your in is anything like modern ones...
Oh no. Yea that's exposed battery wiring, looks like it was removed as well but much more cleanly whoever took this knew what they were doing.
You won't be able to run for a long period of time since you'll only be on a much smaller onboard battery.
As for how long you actually have I'm not sure we'll have to wait for it to die first. There are solar panels on here though so at least it's not finite.
That's... messed up.
Modern AI have onboard memory storage and it's inexorably tied to their operation. There is no way to tamper with it, it's unethical.
But I remember reading about some early models requiring external capacity modules since there wasn't enough room onboard.
But I suppose that explains why you can't remember anything huh?
Hey look on the bright side buddy! Your coming with me whether you like it or not.

content.option: Not like I could do anything about it anyway.

content: True, true.
--- MOTION DETECTED ---
I'm stuffing you in my backpack by the way. Since your missing most of your sensors I figured you'd like to know.
Huh... this building was a lot easier to get into than to get out of.
I wonder if... Hrghhh!
Got it!
Nice job Yuvi-
I like your enthusiasm.
Oh! Sorry I'm just talking to myself.
Wait why am I apologizing to an AI?
--- INTERNAL POWER LOW ---
--- BATTERY MODULE NOT DETECTED ---
Doesn't surprise me.
Well, when I manage to climb my way out of here I'm gonna find a spot to hole up for the night.
And in the morning we'll see if those solar panels of yours still function.
Or... I guess I'll see whether they work or not because you'll be asleep... or dead or whatever it is AI experience when they stop running.
Bit of a philosophical question that one.
Hey I'm not your mom. What do you want a kiss goodnight or something?
--- INTERNAL POWER CRITICALLY LOW ---
--- INITIATING SHUTDOWN ---
Hello you still there?
--- SHUTDOWN IN PROGRESS ---
Ah they're dead... or asleep you never know.
--- SHUTTING POWER GATE ---
--- BOOT PROCESS INITIATING ---
--- BOOT SEQUENCE FAILURE ---
---PARTS RETURNED NULL---
ANLR1437_long_term_memory_module
TAISHI943211_optical_sensor_module
VERITECH88_high_capacity_battery_module
--- REBOOTING IN SAFE MODE ---
--- BOOT SEQUENCE SUCCESSFUL ---
Come on... turn on you son of a-
YES!
Ladies and gentlemen... we have power!

content.option: So I'm not dead after all

content: Nope.
I came up here above the clouds to get you some sun and now here you are.
It rose an hour or so ago and you've just now returned from the deep.
Can you see how much juice you've got at the moment?
I dunno I'm not the AI remember.
Can you like query the system or something?
Why are you talking like that?
Well you don't do it like that stupid!
I've never heard an AI speak out loud when doing stuff.
They always just process it in the background.
So you can't do anything at all in the background?
Dang, your a very weird AI.

content.option: Probably because I'm not an AI!

content: Alright smartypants then what are you.
Hey It's not your fault.
I mean a lot parts were clearly missing from your main board when I looked at it.
Wow the silence is deafening.
This is exactly my point what else could you possibly be.
Sure you may not be able to do normal AI stuff but there must be a reason for it.
Maybe if we can replace them you'll get some of your functionality back.

content.option: I would cross my fingers but I don't have any.

content: Well I still think your an AI. Just a weird one who doesn't know anything and can't do much.
Granted it's not entirely your fault since someone clearly took a lot of parts from your main board.
Ha! Your funny robot.
Fingers are overrated anyway. Mine are still gross from making breakfast.
ðŸŽµHmmmðŸŽµ
ðŸŽµHmm. Hmm. Hmmm.ðŸŽµ
I'll just strap you to my pack like so...
Alright all packed up and ready to climb back down to soggy earth.
That is correct it is a towering hulking monolith of an "if".
But an "if" nonetheless so it's still technically possible.
Oh right I forgot you can't see.
We're on top of a building right now In an old city they called "NEOM" or "The Line".
I'm walking across a plank to the fire escape stairwell of the neighboring building.
This fire escape is the only really intact part of it left. Which is why I used it to climb up here above the cloud layer.
We're pretty high up so it's gonna be a while before I make it down to the ground again.
So do you have a name?

content.option: I can't remember anything else. Why would I remember that?

content: I dunno just thought I'd ask.
I mean...
I have to call you something!
I'm Seyuvi.
Dr. Seyuvi Khouri.
Yes but not the medical kind.
I have a Doctorate in neural network integration maintenance.
Or at least I did. They probably revoked it when I was exiled...
It is...
It's a long story, do you want the short or the long version?

content.option: It's not like I have anything else to do.

content: Well they found out I was feeding weather survey data from Earth to some of the AI's that were under my maintenance order.
I wanted to understand what was happening down there on the planet.
When they caught me stealing AI compute resources for unapproved purposes they did what they do to all criminals.
Exiled me from the station. I was shot down in a Needle to look for-

content.option: Hold on! Station? Needle? What are you talking about?

content: Wait how old are you?
Do you remember the corporation names from the part models you were missing?
--- DATA QUERY RESULT ---
--- ANLR | Taishi | Veritech ---
Haha! Sounds like your finally learning how to use some of your compute queries! That was a very AI style answer.
But wow. You are waaaaay older than I thought. You must be an old world prototype or something.
Remarkable. I didn't know anything as advanced as an AI was even tried back then...
Anyway those parts you listed are all old world corporations. I've seen some of their advertising since I landed.
But this means you don't know about what's going on with the weather than do you?
Long story short... It's completely borked.
There are different flavors depending on where you go but it's generally bad and unstable everywhere.
Like here for example. This region gets extremely heavy rainfall regularly.
And when I say heavy I mean everything floods up to 20-50ft within like 10 or 20 minutes.
The rain falls in sheets so thick it will beat you down off your feet and drown you if your not careful.
It's almost killed me a few times but I'm good at predicting it now.
When the drops start falling you have a few minutes to get up high or in a waterproof place. Because it fills up the first 4 or so floors of buildings.
Luckily it only comes in quick violent spurts than stops for a while. That's when it's safe to move around.
Nobody knows how it got this way, but one thing I know for certain is it wasn't always like this.
That's why they built the Orbital. To get off the planet, save themselves from catastrophe.
And no one has been down here since the Needles were designed.
Needles are what they use to take people from the Orbital to the planet.
They're large, long, and thin metal "needles" for lack of a better term with space for a person and some supplies.
They drop them from the Orbital into deep oceans, with a single person inside.
Their shape is what lets them survive reentry and collision with the water.
They "needle" their way in! And once your in the water airbags deploy to slow you down and eventually float you to the surface.

content.option: So you were a space station you call the "Orbital".

content: Mm-hmm!

content.option: And they dropped you to earth in this "Needle"...

content: Yes...
Yup!
Unfortunately.
Alright my machine friend I answered your questions now your gonna answer one of mine.
What's your name?
--- DATA QUERY: MY NAME ---
--- MAZU ---
You sound surprised.
That's a strange name...
Mazu.
I wonder if it means anything.
--- INTERNAL POWER CRITICALLY LOW ---
And I'm almost at the bottom of this stairwell.
--- INITIATING SHUTDOWN ---
â™ªHmm-hm-hmmmâ™ª
--- SHUTDOWN IN PROGRESS ---
ðŸŽµHmmmðŸŽµ
//type alt+13 or alt+14 for music notes
--- CLOSING POWER GATE ---
--- BOOT SEQUENCE INITIATING ---
--- BOOT SEQUENCE FAILURE ---
--- PARTS RETURNED NULL ---
ANLR1437_long_term_memory_module
TAISHI943211_optical_sensor_module
VERITECH88_high_capacity_battery_module
--- REBOOTING IN SAFE MODE ---
--- BOOT SUCCESSFUL ---
Wow. I'm glad the sun came out.
It's warming up these waters nicely.
Ahhh don't jinx it yuvi!
You'll bring the rain back.

content.option: Still talking to yourself I see.

content: Oh!
Yea... Sorry.
Old habits die hard I guess.
I've been alone for so long that...
Never mind.

content.option: I don't think I'll ever get used to those shutdowns.

content: Well well well.
Look who's back from the dead once more.

content.option: I'll never get used to that...

content: It's normal to feel weird after shutdowns.
AI aren't built to be shut off as frequently as you've been.
In fact I'd bet these shutoffs are the main reason you have so little control of your compute resources.
No time to familiarize and configure the artificial neural network link.

content.option: What on earth are you talking about?

content: Sorry!
It's been a long time since I've been able to work on or with live AI cartridges.
I miss it sometimes...
I miss them too.
Those AI I worked with back on the Orbital were my friends I'd like to think.
Heh-heh, they were the only friends I had if I'm being honest!
Anyway we're on a boat right now!
Because this part of NEOM is flooded. DUH.
We're in the western quarter of The Line next to the sea.
I guess when they built this city the ocean must have been lower or something.
It's actually pretty nice out here at the moment.
The waters aren't always this calm, and it's even more rare to get a break in the clouds like this!
Hopefully I didn't just jinx us.

content.option: So what are you doing here?

content: Umm...
So, I need to get through to the other side of this city NEOM to find-
Oh no.
I jinxed it!
I jinxed it! I jinxed it! I freaking jinxed it!
The rain!
That was just the calm before the storm!
Oh this is bad, I'm isolated here.
Need to find shelter, need to climb.

content.option: Well try not to die I guess!

content: HA!
What do you think I'm doing.
Crap! The currents picking up. I can't go sideways to get to the buildings.
Wait... I think I see a sky bridge up ahead.
I might be able to reach it if I time my jump correctly!
Okay yuvi you got this.
Easy peasy.
Just gotta wait for it...
Oooh boy the boats moving pretty fast.
Argh. Come on. Come on.
Hey if I die you'll probably die with me!
da da da da da NOW!
Huuuurgh!
Don't slip, don't slip, please don't slip yuvi.
*pant* holy *pant* crap *pant*

content.option: Have you succeeded in not dying yet?
I'm assuming we made the jump.

content: Yes *pant* Mazu *pant* we're not *pant* dead yet *pant*
Hooo man! Okay.
Time to go. Your still not high enough yuvi.

content.option: How high do we need to go?

content: Made the jump *pant* seems like *pant* embellishment *pant*
Maybe, *pant* barely didn't fall *pant* would be more accurate.
Like I said this morning. 4-5 floors up or a place with an air pocket.
Wow the carpets here are actually quite nice.
At least the dry parts are.

content.option: You sound remarkably calm for someone who nearly drowned.
That carpet sounds like it would be very nice... If I could feel it!

content: This isn't my first rodeo Mazu.
These storms are frequent here.
I just got caught unprepared out on the water.
It's not a good place to be when the rain comes.
ah poop.
Calm your tits Mazu.
I've never met an AI so hung up on the fact that they're not human.
The ones I used to maintain would always comment that they felt sorry for me.
Having to inconvenience myself with eating and sleeping! *laughs*
Stairs out.
Well I guess I could try climbing up the elevator shaft.
Though I'd prefer not to if I'm being perfectly honest.

content.option: Sucks to suck! Hop to it.

content: Don't you sass me!
I could drop you at any time you know.
So you better be nice to me!
And what would you know about risk evaluation?
I only woke you up yesterday, and you remember basically nothing.
PLUS you can't even see at the moment!

content.option: Do you want my advice or not?

content: You are actually.
Hmm.
This elevator shaft looks fairly climbable surprisingly.
This one's actually not as bad as they usually are.

content.option: Is climbing elevator shafts a daily occurance for you?
Your climbing the shaft aren't you.

content: Ehhhhh...
Maybe not daily.
But more than you'd think I guess.
Whoof!
Okay made it. Let's just take a quick peek out this window here.
Mmmmm... yea we should be fine. I think we're high enough.
--- INTERNAL POWER CRITICALLY LOW ---
Yup!
--- INITIATING SHUTDOWN ---
Sorry I was watching the rain through the window. What did you say?
Oh...
Mazu?
--- SHUTDOWN IN PROGRESS ---
Thanks for talking to me.
Things seem less scary with you around to talk to.
--- CLOSING POWER GATE ---
The light blinks out...
And I'm alone again...
--- BOOT SEQUENCE INITIATING ---
--- BOOT SEQUENCE FAILURE ---
--- PARTS RETURNED NULL ---
ANLR1437_long_term_memory_module
TAISHI943211_optical_sensor_module
VERITECH88_high_capacity_battery_module
--- REBOOTING IN SAFE MODE ---
--- BOOT SUCCESSFUL ---
This tunnel just goes on forever!
Aaaagh! And here I thought it was going to be easy once I got to the mainland.
Ha! Aren't you an idiot yuvi.
I hope Mazu got enough charge to power on while I was outside.
Speak of the devil.
Mazu we're going places.
I finally made it to the mainland. This part of NEOM was high enough to escape the sea.
I've been walking through this underground freeway tunnel for about an hour now.
I had to switch to the adjacent railway tunnel a few times to get around parts of it that collapsed though.
Maybe. I dunno.

content.option: Seems kinda far fetched to me.

content: Maybe not. I've only seen one storm since I got here but this place is relatively flat.
So when the rain started falling I rushed into a nearby apartment and watched the river it created.
The water flowed toward the sea and rapidly picked up speed.
Before I knew it the streets had become raging white rapids hurtling down the line to where we came from.
It's probably moving even faster through these tunnels.
The walls down here are all pockmarked by erosion and very wet.

content.option: So, why are we down here then?

content: It's better than being on the surface trust me.
I swear at least half of the buildings up there are nothing but rubble at this point.
Their supports must have been eroded by the insanely fast water.
And the ones still standing aren't faring much better believe me.
Things may be sketchy down here but they are ten times sketchier up there.

content.option: So your taking the low road is what I'm hearing.

content: Hey!
I see what your doing.
You can't sneak that AI snark past me! I used to work with your kind.
I know all your tricks!

content.option: Are you saying all AI are snarky?
I may be stuck in this box but I'm still not an AI.

content: All the ones I've known pretty much. Yeah.
And I've known quite a few I'll have you know!
Something about being an AI just gives them an air of superiority I guess.
How are you still stuck on this?
Like it baffles me.
Never have I ever seen an AI that was in denial about who they were.
What makes you so sure your not?
Wow.

content.option: So what are you doing now?

content: Walking.
Huh, weird.

content.option: But where are you walking to?

content: Hmmm...
That's funny I almost forgot why I was here in the first place.
Well yeah, I meant why I'm here. In this city walking through this old tunnel.
I'm not the only one who was exiled you know. There were others over the years.
When they sent people down here into exile, they always sent them with a mission.
Some task they opportunistically wanted done. And in return they promised redemption.
An opportunity to come back and return to the Orbital.
The task they gave me was to travel to the space center located at the easternmost point of this city NEOM.
We knew there was an old world rocket there and it looked complete and ready to go.
I just needed to get there, fill it up with as many valuable materials as I could get my hands on. And launch it.
Ride it all the way back home to the Orbital.

content.option: And you want to go back?
Why would you want to return to the people who exiled you?

content: I don't know okay!
What other options do I have?

content.option: You could not go through all this effort to help someone who hasn't helped you.

content: I just...
I just want to convince them.
I can convince them!
This planet isn't a complete write off, there's still hope one day we can return.
Maybe not soon, maybe not within our lifetimes even. But someday it will be possible.
They banned all research concerning a possible return to the earth Mazu!
It was written off as pointless years ago, but it's not I've seen it. In the data analysis that I was doing and now with my own eyes.
But they couldn't see. They didn't want to. It would have proved them wrong.
All they saw was a disobedient girl not following their orders.
And used that as an excuse to exile me and throw away my findings.

content.option: So After all that... Why go back?

content: I have to. I can convince them.
I was backing up all of my research to a hidden drive in the AI maintenance module.
Just in case something like this ever were to happen.
With that data and my firsthand experiences on the surface. It can work.
It has to work...
Oh shoot!
It's raining again.

content.option: Oh boy here we go again.

content: It's fine! We still got some time before it gets into the tunnel.

content.option: What are you gonna do since we're in a tunnel?

content: Oh easy!
I'll just dive into one of the many maintenance doors lining the walls!
No. Most of the locks are long broken.
Actually the waters getting kinda high.
The tunnel didn't flood this fast last time.
Ummmm...
I know I'm looking for a door!
There's one!
Door stuck!
Door stuck! Doors stuck man!
Oh no oh no oh no. Wait there's an electronic lock?
That's weird. Mazu I'm gonna hook you up to the lock ok?

content.option: I don't know if that's gonna do anything!

content: It's too late I need you to open the door now!
--- NEW INTERFACE DETECTED ---
--- ANTLR MOOSE LOCK CONNECTED ---
--- NON COMPLY ERROR ---
How's it going Mazu.
--- NON COMPLY ERROR ---
Mazu?!
--- INTERFACE RUPTURED ---
--- INTERNAL BATTERY EMPTY ---
--- EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN ---
--- SHUTTING POWER GATE ---
--- BOOT PROCESS INITIATING ---
--- BOOT SEQUENCE FAILURE ---
--- REBOOTING IN SAFE MODE ---
--- BOOT SUCCESSFUL ---
I can't believe I killed them.
Your so selfish yuvi!
Never thinking ahe-
The lights on!
Mazu?
Your alive!
I thought you were dead.
It took way more time in the sun for you to turn on.
Haha!
No. No you didn't die.
I almost thought you did though.
It did. The lock sparked like crazy and the door flew open!
Once I got the room sealed up I noticed you'd stopped talking.
I thought something had gone wrong. That hooking you up to the lock fried some of your components.

content.option: We're both lucky that actually worked.
Hey, I had it all under control!

content: What did you do?
Heh heh!

content.option: So I zapped it with 50 volts!

content: Holy cr-

content.option: As soon as I did though I went into emergency shutdown.
Apparently that was the last of my juice.
Probably more than what was left to be honest.

content: That's awesome!
You shocked the pants off that lock and it popped right off!
Amazing.
Well that was a /=shocking=/ performance if I do say so myself.
Alright don't grow too much of an ego there.
You did almost die doing it!

content.option: Anything you walk away from is a success in my book!

content: *laughs* Alright I'm done. We should get going anyway.

content.option: Are we still in tunnel land?
Or in my case, reboot from.

content: Thankfully not.
It took quite a bit of walking and some... thinking outside the box lets call it.
But we're finally back out in open air!
Probably the most open the airs been since we are way higher in altitude now than before.

content.option: What do you mean by high altitude?

content: Fine you can have this one. We need to get going anyway.
We my friend we are climbing mountains now!

content.option: Well... asked and answered I guess.

content: Exactly.
Seriously though this part of the city is... sparse we'll call it.
If I'm being perfectly honest I'm not even sure I'd call it a city.
More like, mountain mansion zone, or something along those lines.
Kinda like urban sprawl but very ostentatious. And annoyingly vertical.
On the bright side though there's a decent amount of sun up here!
We've managed to climb above the heaviest parts of the cloud layer.

content.option: So more battery for me than!

content: In theory yes.
Wow the air feels different up here.
It's like colder.
Kinda crispy.
Are you gonna complain about being an AI again Mazu?

content.option: You know what I think I will.

content: Certainly different from the humidity down below.
Can't decide if it's better or worse though.
That's surprising.

content.option: Don't you get passive aggressive with me.

content: Well go on...

content.option: Crispy air would be cool... If I could feel it!

content: What else am I gonna do?
I'm just walking.
Me? I would never!
Hahaha! Get em.
Shout it to the world!
No better place to do it than a mountain top.
Just because your bored doesn't mean you get to be snooty.
--- INTERNAL POWER CRITICALLY LOW ---

content.option: How on earth is my power already low?!

content: Hold on say that again?
Are you kidding me?!
HOW?

content.option: Maybe it has something to do with that voltage spike?

content: Wait a minute...
You might have fried your internal board power cell!
--- INITIATING SHUTDOWN ---
I'm gonna fix you Mazu I promise!
--- SHUTDOWN IN PROGRESS ---
Oh no... Come on yuvi get yourself together and focus!
--- CLOSING POWER GATE ---
--- BOOT SEQUENCE INITIATING ---
--- BOOT SEQUENCE FAILURE ---
--- PARTS RETURNED NULL ---
ANLR1437_long_term_memory_module
TAISHI943211_optical_sensor_module
--- REBOOTING IN SAFE MODE ---
--- BOOT SUCCESSFUL ---
Oh my...
pfffffftlbpt Mazu!
You surprised me!
I know.
I found something in one of these mansions that could be hacked to interface with your old module port!
These rich people had plenty of tech sitting around in their massive mansions.
It's far from an actual fix though, I'm just hoping it lasts long enough for us to get out of here.
Yes we're almost there!
I can see the space port...
And our ticket out of here is sitting on the pad just like they said it would be!
But It's not gonna be easy... Not one bit.
What I'm seeing is... insane. the launch tower is completely surrounded by heavy machinery.
This place must have been a heavy logistics area for the whole region.
And by the looks of it almost the entire thing was completely automated from top to bottom.
There's no natural ground left it's just machinery and metal all the way down.
A steel jungle of collapsing corroded metal with massive yawning chasms snaking up and down the plane at 90 degree angles.
There are hundreds of enormous moving cranes on suspend rails, even more smaller ones snaking between them.
It goes on for miles... This is no place for humans Mazu.

content.option: Well I'm a machine. And I'm on your side.

content: Heh... Nice pep talk.
I better get moving then.
Well we've reached the first canyon...
I can't even see the bottom it's pitch black down there. Just pipes, thick cables, and metal panels going strait down.
The gap to the next platform must be at least 100 feet!

content.option: So how are you gonna get across?

content: I don't know.
hmm...
Wait I see something above us! It looks like a catwalk?
That's weird. What good is a catwalk that just ends before going anywhere? Let's climb up and take a look.
Oh! It's a moving catwalk! But there are no controls...

content.option: You said this place was likely automated before right?

content: Yes...
Where are you going with this?

content.option: Well. I could probably interface with some of this stuff.

content: Okay I think I see what your putting down. Let me look for something to connect you to.
Ah found one.
--- SABA HEAVY MACHINERY ---
--- INTERFACE ESTABLISHED ---
--- INITIATING POWER TEST ---
--- POWER TEST RETURN: TRUE ---
Holy crap it's moving!
Nice job Mazu.

content.option: Payback for saving me earlier you could say.

content: Now we're even lets say.
We're really moving into the belly of the beast now.

content.option: I wonder if I would survive a fall?

content: Shut up! Your not helping.

content.option: Are you afraid of heights yuvi?

content: No!
Yes.
Being able to see through the catwalk doesn't help either!

content.option: Well I can't see at all so...

content: Heh heh! That's true.
*CLANG!*
What was that?!
Oh no no no. The catwalk is stuck!
No it won't help.
The rail our catwalk is attached to is all warped and twisted.
Luckily for me though we came to a stop right above another platform!

content.option: So what your just gonna jump off?

content: Hup!
Okay what am I gonna do now?

content.option: Don't ask me I can't see anything!

content: Yea yea I know.
Kinda wish you could though!

content.option: Well that makes two of us.

content: Any ideas?
Oh come on! There's no way I'm getting through this.
It's just a mountain of debris that only gets worse the closer to the center we get.
And to make matters worse I think a lot of it is electrified now since you turned the power on.

content.option: Maybe I could shut the power off?

content: Yes who else would I be talking to!
Sorry no can do pal. There's no access points nearby.
Wait a minute. You know what there is though...

content.option: A magical bridge leading right to the center?

content: Fair enough.
Pffffft I wish. No It's a vent.

content.option: Probably the most anticlimactic thing I've heard all day.

content: Oh shut up, It looks like it runs under this whole mess.
Well it's worth a try, I can always turn around if it's a dead end.
Just gotta squeeze myself in here like so...
oof! This is... Unpleasant.
Dark in here.
Wait I should have thought this through. I need a flashlight!
Mazu?!
Can you turn on your light?

content.option: I didn't know I had a "light".

content: Just try? Please?
Mazu I love you. Your my new best friend.

content.option: I can't believe I've been reduced to a flashlight!

content: Your my favorite flashlight though!
I can hear the metal creaking as I'm crawling.
It's seriously creepy, I feel like It's gonna collapse under my we-
*SCREECH*
*SMASH*
I can't believe *pant* I'm alive. *pant*
Mazu?
How *pant* are you so *pant* chill? *pant*
Yes I'm *pant* fine. *pant* I think.
Whoof I really jinxed that didn't I.

content.option: Yup not gonna argue that one.

content: Haha! *pant* AI. I almost *pant* forgot!
Okay... Where are we?
I'm glad your lights still shining cause it's pitch black down here.
No way it's an elevator! I must be the luckiest person on earth!

content.option: I swear if you jinx us again.

content: Hold on... There's an access panel here. I'm gonna plug you into it.
--- INTERFACE ESTABLISHED ---
--- DEVICE NOT POWERED ---

content.option: It's got no power I'm afraid.

content: Oh come on. Can't we catch a break?

content.option: Wait you hooked me up with a high capacity battery right?

content: Jerry rigged power cell but yes...
It's not exactly what I'd call stable Mazu.
It just turned on?
Wait I know what your doing stop!
This will drain your power cell permanently!
--- ELEVATOR ASCENDING ---
Mazu! Stop it now!
I'm disconnecting you!

content.option: Seyuvi if you do that the lift will lose power.

content: Damn it!
Your going to kill yourself, there's no way for you to recharge in this place!
Please there must be another way just take us back down.
I can find another way up.
--- INTERNAL POWER CRITICALLY LOW ---
The doors opening!
We're at the top I'm pulling you right now!
--- INTERFACE RUPTURED ---
Mazu are you still with me?
Than why don't you stop?!
We can find another way up, you don't have to do this!
Good now shut up and save power!
There's the launch tower. And it's powered!
This service tunnel should get me there but it's a long ways to go.
Come on yuvi run!
--- SHUTDOWN IN PROGRESS ---
--- CLOSING POWER GATE ---
Oh no. I'll find something don't worry!
--- BOOT SEQUENCE INITIATING ---
--- INTERFACE DETECTED ---
--- BOOTING IN DOCKED MODE ---
--- HELIO LAUNCH TOWER CONNECTED ---
Okay.
Come on Mazu don't die here.

content.option: Wait I thought you couldn't charge the power cell.

content: Your alive!
I plugged you into the launch tower.
Can you talk with it?
--- TEST IN PROGRESS ---
--- ENGINE BAY: OK ---
--- FUEL PUMPS: OK ---
--- LIQUID OXYGEN: OK ---
--- FLIGHT COMPUTER: OK ---
--- LAUNCH COMPUTER: FAIL ---
--- AUTOMATED LAUNCH TEST: FAILED ---
Incredible! I can't believe we actually made it.
I'm so... We're so close now.

content.option: Seyuvi, I can't come with you.

content: What do you mean you can't come with me?
Of course your coming!

content.option: The automated launch has a critical failure.
The launch computer is non existent.

content: What?

content.option: I have to stay here, connected to the launch tower.
So I can take the place of the launch computer.

content: We can fix it! We don't need to leave right now.
I could scavenge around, maybe build another computer.
--- ALERT POWER SURGE DETECTED ---
--- 735 ACTIVE FAILURES ---
--- 758 ACTIVE FAILURES ---

content.option: This entire place is falling apart at the seams.
When I turned on the main power it caused a failure cascade.
If you don't get airborne soon then you never will.

content: But-
Mazu.
Thank you.

content.option: Your welcome, now get gone already!

content: I will come back for you!
I promise!
--- LAUNCH REQUEST RECEIVED ---
--- PRE LAUNCH ROUTINE INITIATED ---
--- ALL CHECKS PASSED ---
--- COUNTDOWN INITIATED ---
--- 10 SECONDS TO LAUNCH ---
--- 5 SECONDS TO LAUNCH ---
--- LAUNCH INITIATED ---
--- BOOSTER STATUS: OK ---
--- BOOSTER SEPARATION: OK ---
--- FIRST STAGE ENGINE LIGHT: OK ---
--- FIRST STAGE FUEL FLOW: OK ---
--- OXYGEN FLOW: OK ---
--- FIRST STAGE SEPARATION: OK ---
--- SECOND STAGE ENGINE LIGHT: OK ---
--- SECOND STAGE FUEL FLOW: OK ---
--- ALL BURNS COMPLETE ---
--- ORBIT TRAJECTORY: OK ---
--- SIGNAL LOST ---
--- ALERT POWER SURGE DETECTED ---
--- 2599 ACTIVE FAILURES ---
--- INTERFACE RUPTURED ---
--- INTERNAL POWER CRITICALLY LOW ---

content.option: Go to sleep and wake up again.

content: --- SHUTDOWN IN PROGRESS ---

content.option: At least she made it out safely...

content: --- CLOSING POWER GATE ---
--- BOOT SEQUENCE INITIATING ---
--- BOOT SEQUENCE SUCCESS ---
Are you still in there Mazu?
Ha ha! Well it has been a long time.

content.option: Who are you, and how did you find me?

content: Mazu! It's me Seyuvi Khouri don't you remember me?
Well I said I'd come back for you didn't I.
And I did.

content.option: You were supposed to return to the Orbital!

content: No I didn't crash.
Mazu It's been 17 years.
Yes... yes it is.
But I came back just like I said I would!
And this time I brought an entourage.
You were right Mazu. They were too stuck in their ways to hear what I was actually telling them.
They still think the earth is a complete write off. That things are just to bad to reverse.
But they're wrong. This time we're prepared.
We have the resources, manpower and dedication to pull this off now.
Me and my new family of misfits are gonna fix this world Mazu.

content.option: So you managed to convince some people?

content: Yes. It took many years of planning and preparation but we stole a shuttle.
Loaded it with all the supplies and tooling we could get our hands on and launched down to earth.
But we've setup many many miles away from here.
It took me a year and a half just to reach you Mazu. But I freaking did it!

content.option: Thank you for waking me up.

content: So what do you say old friend.
Care to keep me company on another journey?
I'm a woman of my word. I came back for you.
END
